definitions.definition: Side by side and facing forward .

definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 17 century.
First attested in the mid 17 century.

definitions.definition: Followed by of or with : up to a certain level or line; equally advanced.
examples: She believes it is important to keep abreast of new scientific developments.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 17 century.

examples: The west wind blew a tempest, and, according to the common expression, brought in the water [of the Solway] three foot abreast .

definitions.definition: Side by side; also, opposite; on a line with the vessel 's beam.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the late 17 century.

main_definition: Side by side and facing forward . [First attested from around (1350 to 1470.)]
secondary_definitions: ( figurative ) Alongside; parallel to. [First attested in the mid 17 century.]
Informed, well-informed, familiar, acquainted. [First attested in the mid 17 century.]
Followed by of or with : up to a certain level or line; equally advanced. [First attested in the mid 17 century.]
( Scotland ) Breast high (of an advancing wave).
( nautical ) Side by side; also, opposite; on a line with the vessel 's beam. [First attested in the late 17 century.]
( obsolete ) At the same time; simultaneously .
